comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Harry Franklin "Slim" Sallee (February 3, 1885 - March 23, 1950) was a former professional baseball player. He was a left-handed pitcher over parts of fourteen seasons (1908–1921) with the St. Louis Cardinals, New York Giants and Cincinnati Reds. For his career, he compiled a 174-143 record in 476 appearances, with an 2.56 earned run average and 836 strikeouts. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slim_Sallee
